title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.38 | 20-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: The great heroes of the Yadu dynasty being protected by the arms of Lord Shri Krishna always remain fearless in every respect.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse and explains that the Yadavas, protected by Krishna, are fearless and enjoy a high position.
The speaker emphasizes the importance of the Yadavas.

segments.key_quote: Krishna's devotees have a very special position. This material world is characterized by fear.
segments.summary: Krishna's devotees are protected from fear and enjoy the best things because of Krishna's affection.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is also called devotee. Bhakta vatsala. He is specially affectionate towards his pure devotees.
segments.summary: Krishna is especially affectionate to devotees, and Dwaraka was enriched with the best things, surpassing even the heavenly assembly house Sudharma.

segments.key_quote: During the time of Lord Krishna, the members of the Yadu dynasty forcibly brought the celestial assembly house to earth and placed it at Dwaraka.
segments.summary: The Yadu dynasty brought the Sudharma assembly house to Dwaraka to please Krishna, demonstrating pure devotion.

segments.key_quote: They were able to use such force because they were certain of the indulgence and protection of the Supreme Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: Devotees serve Krishna with the best offerings, and Krishna reciprocates by providing protection and fearlessness.

segments.key_quote: A forgetful, conditioned soul is fearful. That's our position now.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difference between a conditioned soul, who is fearful due to forgetfulness of Krishna, and a liberated soul, who is fearless.

segments.key_quote: Just as a small child, completely dependent on the mercy of his father, is never fearful of anyone.
segments.summary: Fear is an illusion arising from forgetting our eternal relationship with the Lord, similar to a child's fearlessness due to dependence on their father.

segments.key_quote: Fearfulness is due to forgetting the eternal relation with the Lord.
segments.summary: Fearfulness arises from identifying with the body and forgetting our eternal nature, leading to the fear of death.

segments.key_quote: This is just like, Prabhupada gives an example, in a dream a person may see, while sleeping, in a dream he may see a tiger.
segments.summary: Using the analogy of a dream, the speaker explains that fear is an illusion, and by being awake in service to the Lord, like the Yadu dynasty, one can overcome fear.
